critique: The document expresses sympathy and support for Mrs. Alice Tasker, who was discharged from her position due to an injury. The president is attempting to convey a sense of compassion and a desire to rectify the situation by recommending her reinstatement. There is no indication of anger, fear, disgust, or surprise. The primary emotions conveyed are sadness (due to her situation) and a mild sense of joy (in hoping for her reinstatement).
